A minibus travels along a straight line parallel to the x-axis. The minibus makes $n$ stops at points $(x_1, 0), (x_2, 0), ..., (x_n, 0)$, where $x_1 = 0$ and $x_1 < x_2 < ... < x_n$. The minibus travels at a constant speed of $v_b$.

A person is on the minibus and wants to reach a university located at $(x_u, y_u)$. The person can only get off the minibus at one of the stops and then run to the university at a constant speed of $v_s$.

Find the index of the bus stop that minimizes the time it takes for the person to reach the university. If there are multiple bus stops that result in the same minimum time, choose the one closest to the university.

A person is on a bus traveling at a constant speed. The bus makes several stops along a straight line. The person wants to get to a destination as quickly as possible. They can get off the bus at any stop and run to the destination at a different speed.  What stop should they get off at to minimize travel time?
